creditline: The Modernism Collection, gift of Norwest Bank Minnesota
description: polished cast-iron with fountain motif; two removable feet; originally backed with a fine wire mesh screen
image_copyright: © Artist Rights Society %28ARS%29%2C New York %2F ADAGP%2C Paris
text: A fountain seems an unusual decoration for a fire screen. But it became a favorite motif of designers in the 1920s, and allowed Brandt to show his skill in creating complex curving forms in the seemingly un-malleable material of iron. To achieve the fountain’s graceful curves and the swirling leaves and stems, Brandt used both traditional iron forging and newfound techniques like torch welding.
title: Firescreen
